1.title: Episode #3.1
1.plot: Lindsey and Eric buy an abandoned, overgrown home and hope to update the design and maximize on the stunning mountain views. However, many obstacles stand in their way, including a 50-foot tree that's grown into the roof.

2.title: Episode #3.2
2.plot: Lindsey and Eric take a risk when they overpay for an "easy" flip. They decide to add high-end finishes that they hope will attract high-end buyers, but mounting renovation costs prove this flip to be anything but easy.

3.title: Episode #3.3
3.plot: With low inventory in the desert, Lindsey and Eric decide to take a chance on a home at the end of an airport runway. The key to the flip is blowing away buyers with an open concept inside and massive entertaining space outside.

4.title: Episode #3.4
4.plot: Lindsey and Eric face rising temperatures and renovation costs while attempting to turn a house with a strange layout into a beautiful four-bedroom home with potential for profit.

5.title: Episode #3.5
5.plot: Lindsey and Eric Bennett face rising renovation costs and a risky investment while flipping a home for a quick profit.

6.title: Episode #3.6
6.plot: Lindsey and Eric find a five-bedroom home with an appealing list price, but the messy interior was left in a state of mid-renovation. Upgraded finishes and better outdoor appeal should make this flip compete with the pack.

7.title: Episode #3.7
7.plot: An easy in-and-out renovation gets messy when Lindsey and Eric run into unexpected, costly issues like a roof in disrepair and major electrical problems. The pressure is on to sell this simple farmhouse for top dollar.

8.title: Episode #3.8
8.plot: The team hurriedly picks up a home at asking price but quickly find out about its many risks and the amount of work required to overcome them.

9.title: Episode #3.9
9.plot: A fire damaged home with a low price tag and high risk is on the market, and Lindsey and Eric seem to be the only ones willing to take on the challenge. What looks like a few charred walls turns out to be a much larger issue when major roof repairs are thrown in the mix, ballooning the costs and shrinking the profit. The flippers will have to make some hard decisions on design if they want to attract buyers while still staying under budget and on schedule.

10.title: Episode #3.10
10.plot: Lindsey and Eric face a rare desert torrential downpour that threatens to ruin their flip and their profit while updating every room in a three-bedroom house.

11.title: Episode #3.11
11.plot: Eric and Lindsey Bennett bid on and win a property sight unseen. The well-maintained home has an outdated style but no major red flags, so it seems like a good bet until a crack in the floor is revealed and threatens their budget.

12.title: Episode #3.12
12.plot: Eric and Lindsey transform a rundown property in a desirable neighborhood into a midcentury masterpiece.

13.title: Episode #3.13
13.plot: Eric and Lindsey tackle a home he's had his eye on for over a year in a luxury neighborhood. However, the risky flip gets even riskier when they run into permitting issues and thousands of dollars worth of equipment is stolen.

14.title: Episode #3.14
14.plot: Eric and Lindsey Bennett take on a property in disrepair that has been deemed a tear-down by the seller. The flippers think they can salvage the home, but the more they uncover, the more frightening this flip becomes.

1.title: Squatters and Scorpions
1.plot: Eric and Lindsey buy a Palm Springs property sight unseen, but once they get inside they see that it's been trashed by squatters and inhabited by scorpions. Can they turn this home into paradise before their new baby arrives?

2.title: It Takes a Villa
2.plot: Eric and Lindsey take on a Tuscan villa with a gutted kitchen, an in-ground pool that's plagued with pests, and overgrown landscaping. During the renovation, they deal with costly mistakes and supply shortages, which lead to unwanted frustration and a ballooning budget.

3.title: This Mold House
3.plot: A house that's stuck in the past is brought into the future. But not without a few obstacles along the way, including surprise leaks, a landscaping blunder and unwanted guests in the kitchen.

4.title: Battling the Desert Elements
4.plot: Eric and Lindsey bust into their new purchase only to realize it may have been boarded up for a reason. Spray painted walls, an unbearable stench and a blustery backyard keep the buyers at bay. Will this arid home be their demise?

5.title: Bigger, Better, Boulder
5.plot: Eric and Lindsey deal with expensive and unexpected problems, including a leaky pipe and rotting roof, while trying to squeeze a profit out of this flip.

6.title: Winning Combination
6.plot: Eric and Lindsey take on a hilltop house. Included: A utility closet and Eric's concern over the bottom line and a balanced budget pose an obstacle to Lindsey's ideal open-concept design.

7.title: Budding Problems
7.plot: A mid-century flip turns into a modern-day nightmare when Lindsey and Eric uncover an unwelcome surprise behind a locked casita door.

8.title: Little Big Flip
8.plot: Eric and Lindsey reach for the sky as they renovate a quaint condominium. However, they run into budget issues due to a broken air conditioning unit.

1.title: Uneasy Street
1.plot: Lindsey and Eric take a risk by flipping a house on a noisy road.

2.title: A Prickly Situation
2.plot: Lindsey and Eric buy a property that is lacking in both function and form. They set out to rework the home's funky floor plan. Included: problems like a broken AC system; and a cactus with a mean streak.

3.title: From Pit to Poolside
3.plot: Lindsey and Eric take on the challenge of reviving a mid-century modern home that was abandoned mid-renovation.

4.title: Worst House, Best Block
4.plot: Eric and Lindsey take a chance on a less-than-luxurious home located in a luxury neighborhood. They need to make the home competitive in the tough market, but termites and a rotten overhang threaten to sideline their plan to boost this house to the A-list.

5.title: Trashy to Flashy
5.plot: Lindsey and Eric take a risk buying a home sight unseen.

6.title: Desert Blues
6.plot: Lindsey and Eric purchase a seemingly easy flip, but realize the house is not structurally sound and must make bold decisions.

7.title: Funky Floor Plan
7.plot: Lindsey and Eric's flip project is plagued by windstorms that threaten to blow away any chance of making a profit. The duo completely overhauls the home's existing floor plan with some stunning design ideas.

8.title: Go Bold or Go Home
8.plot: Lindsey and Eric go big restoring a termite-infested mid-century gem. The duo makes some bold design choices such as vibrant orange tiles, a pink front door, and a cocktail grove addition in the back yard. They go against the fundamentals of flipping by getting rid of a room to enhance the outdoor living space.

9.title: A Hot House
9.plot: Lindsey and Eric take on a 1949 semi-open concept ranch house. However, they quickly realize that not everything can withstand the test of time and they must get creative to revamp this old house.

10.title: A Pool With A View
10.plot: A mountaintop home that is abandoned mid-renovation looks to be a diamond in the rough for Lindsey and Eric. The house has plenty to work with, but they quickly realize why the previous owner gave up in the first place.

imdb.plot outline: Wisconsin transplants Eric and Lindsey Bennett are transforming sunny Palm Springs, California one dilapidated house at a time. Renovating 20 properties a year while raising two small children is no small feat, and this couple takes it in stride. But when you go behind the walls of houses that live in triple-digit heat, you never know what you might find, scorpions, rattlesnakes, black widows and even squatters. In each episode of Desert Flippers , Eric and Lindsey search out a diamond in the rough, but they might find something that's just plain rough.
imdb.title: Desert Flippers
plot: Wisconsin transplants Eric and Lindsey Bennett are transforming sunny Palm Springs, California one dilapidated house at a time. Renovating 20 properties a year while raising two small children is no small feat, and this couple takes it in stride. But when you go behind the walls of houses that live in triple-digit heat, you never know what you might find, scorpions, rattlesnakes, black widows and even squatters. In each episode of _Desert Flippers_ (qv) , Eric and Lindsey search out a diamond in the rough, but they might find something that's just plain rough.
